intro: Dortmanna hartwegii, commonly known as the Hartweg's dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a distinctive reddish or purple coloration on the underside. The small, greenish-white flowers appear in dense clusters and are arranged in a raceme.
